title: Chinese state hackers use rootkit to hide ToneShell malware activity
summary: Chinese state-sponsored hackers have developed a sophisticated rootkit to stealthily embed and conceal the ToneShell malware within infected systems. This tactic allows the attackers to maintain persistent access to compromised networks while evading detection from security mechanisms. The rootkit's primary function is to hide the presence and activity of this malware, making it challenging for cybersecurity teams to identify and address the breach. title: Latent Sculpting for Zero-Shot Generalization: A Manifold Learning Approach to Out-of-Distribution Anomaly Detection
summary: In the article "Latent Sculpting for Zero-Shot Generalization: A Manifold Learning Approach to Out-of-Distribution Anomaly Detection," the authors introduce a novel method called Latent Sculpting, which enhances zero-shot generalization by effectively detecting anomalies in out-of-distribution data. This approach utilizes manifold learning techniques to capture the intrinsic structure of normal data, sculpting the latent space to isolate irregularities introduced by unknown distributions. title: Procurement Power—When Cities Realized They Can Just Say No: 2025 in Review
summary: In the article "Procurement Power—When Cities Realized They Can Just Say No: 2025 in Review," the author examines the transformative shift in municipal procurement practices that took place in 2025. Cities across the globe have increasingly recognized their power to influence social and environmental outcomes through strategic purchasing decisions. title: Pruning Graphs by Adversarial Robustness Evaluation to Strengthen GNN Defenses
summary: The article discusses a novel approach to enhancing the robustness of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) against adversarial attacks by employing adversarial robustness evaluation as a criterion for graph pruning. This method involves selectively removing potentially vulnerable edges and nodes from the network graph to fortify the GNN against malicious perturbations that could degrade its performance. title: Fortinet Warns of New Attacks Exploiting Old Vulnerability
summary: Fortinet has issued an alert regarding new cyberattacks that exploit an old vulnerability within their software products. Despite the availability of patches, many systems remain unupdated, leaving them susceptible to these attacks. The vulnerability in question allows attackers to execute unauthorized code, potentially leading to data breaches and system compromises. Fortinet emphasizes the importance of promptly applying security updates and maintaining a proactive security posture to safeguard against these threats.
